alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Caroline and northwestern Essex Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Milford. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elevon, Beazley, Sparta, Central Point and Salvia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen
